;;;  DEA is Doug Appelt (SRI)
;;;  WMT is Mabry Tyson (SRI)

;; DEA - I tried to be fairly consistent about the "new information" rule.
;;DEA  I declared templates for events that describe or refer to terrorist acts
;;DEA   as optional if they don't present any new information.  For example:
;;DEA    "X once again blamed the goverment for killing the six jesuits"
;;DEA    "I refer to the massacre of the six jesuits as an example..."
;;DEA  Generally incidents reported in the main body of the text are considered
;;DEA    real if they fill other constraints on specificity and timeliness.
;;DEA    I declared optional those that are "mentioned in passing" while discussing
;;DEA    some other point.

;;DEA In general I hate a profusion of alternatives for the string fills.  Here was
;;DEA My algorithm for determining string fills:

;;DEA Include the head noun, with an appositive as an alternative.
;;DEA Besides the head noun, I include prenominal modifiers, but not the determiner
;;DEA unless the determiner is posessive.  I exclude relative clauses and
;;DEA PPs, unless the preposition is "OF".


;;DEA This is unchanged

;;DEA Althought the article mentions explosion, firings of weapons and an act of arson,
;;DEA there is nothing that directly states the cause of death of those who were murdered.
;;DEA The phrase "search the rooms, kill them ...." sort of suggests shooting,
;;DEA because you get the impression that they're going through the building and when
;;DEA they find someone hiding under the bed they drag them out and shoot them.

;;DEA I really don't think there's enough here to draw any conclusions about instruments
;;DEA used in the actual killings.

0.  MESSAGE: ID                     DEV-MUC3-0990 (SRI)

;;DEA This is a tough call.
;;DEA Originally this was declared irrelevant, and in the world of perfect human
;;DEA knowledge, it would be.  But if you look at the actual text,
;;DEA it doesn't give you any information to conclude that Gacha is a bad guy.
;;DEA This comes out of our store of knowledge about these cocaine guys.
;;DEA The article doesn't give a clue about who Gacha is.
;;DEA On the other hand, it isn't clear that this is state sponsored violence either,
;;DEA because the article doesn't explicity say that Gacha is an innocent civilian,
;;DEA and police do often shoot and kill criminals.
;;DEA So without invoking specific knowledge about drug lords and the tendency of
;;DEA Colombian police toward violence, I'll make this an optional
;;DEA state sponsored violence template.

;;; gk converted single murder to attack
